item.title: About Josh
item.description: I am a graduate student working with Roman Grigoriev in the Center for Non-Linear Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology. My research interests include non-linear dynamics, pattern formation, as well as coherent structures and extreme behavior in turbulence. So many other fields of science have robust conceptual frameworks to pull from. Non-linear field theories, in general, lack a well-understood “toolbox” and for that reason, their dynamics is an incredibly exciting area of study. It’s just waiting for us to make the right change in perspective and understand it. To date, reduced-order models are our best bet, which is why I study pattern formation and exact coherent structure theory. Using these tools, I try to make sense of how the world around me works.
